results.title: Children of Japan
results.brief_description: A study of the daily life of a middle-class Japanese family immediately before World War II. The contrast between the influence of Western technology and the traditional customs and habits of the Japanese people is reflected in their environment.
results.description: A study of the daily life of a middle-class Japanese family immediately before World War II. The contrast between the influence of Western technology and the traditional customs and habits of the Japanese people is reflected in their environment.

results.title: The Child molester
results.creator_credit: Herbert J. Leder and HSF Safety and Training
results.brief_description: Emphasises the dangers of attack on children and dramatizes typical approaches. The film shows what can be done to reduce the problem by making children aware of molesters and the precautions to be taken when accosted by strangers.

results.title: A Child is a child (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Molly Gorelick, A L Levitt, AIMS Instructional Media and Dubnoff Center
results.brief_description: Shows children with handicaps integrated with non-handicapped children in the pre-school laboratory at California State University, Northridge. It shows that the trend towards special education for children with handicaps has gone so far that many educators tend to lose sight of the fundamental fact that a child is a child.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Molly Gorelick, A L Levitt, AIMS Instructional Media and Dubnoff Center

results.title: Child draw nearer
results.creator_credit: Annie Mygind, Martin Shuttleworth and Bristol Films
results.brief_description: This film shows the advances made at a special school for teaching autistic children and how they began to respond to patience and to use language in a normal way. Commentary by Norman Tyrrell and Val Bryan.

results.title: Chester: a portrait of a city
results.creator_credit: Jim Clark, Ray Gosling and Granada Television International
results.brief_description: A sceptical young man investigates Chester - its history, architecture, institutions, day-to-day life. After walking its streets, travelling its river and canals, talking to its people, the young man is converted.

results.title: Cheryl and Kevin
results.creator_credit: Michael Thornhill, Timothy Read and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Cheryl and Kevin are a young couple who have married before either was ready for the experience. Depicts and provokes thought about one of the major social problems to emerge from modern society and the changing values of young people.

results.title: Elementary experiments in the chemistry of water
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the following elementary experiments which illustrate the chemistry of water. 1. Exploding one part of oxygen with two parts of hydrogen to form water. 2. Passing an electric current through pure water and salt solution. 3. Burning hydrogen to form water vapour. 4. Electrolysis of water.

results.title: Chemical conquest
results.creator_credit: Larry Gosnell, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film report on how chemical research is on the side of the farmer in battle against the plagues that threaten his crops. Insects, plant diseases and weeds come under close scrutiny as scientists develop new formulas to check the invasions to which field and garden crops are subject. The film shows laboratory experiments at a government research station and examines the questions that still need to be answered about the ultimate effects of toxic substances on food-producing soil. Narrated by James Tapp.

results.title: Chelsea Football Club
results.creator_credit: Frank Gardner and British Information Services
results.brief_description: Behind the scenes and on the field with the Chelsea Football Club. The men and methods behind the organization of this well-known club are pictured, and the training required for players in both the main and reserve teams is described. Ends with an exciting Saturday afternoon league game.

results.title: The Charter of the United Nations
results.creator_credit: Alexander Shaw and Crown Film Unit
results.brief_description: An explanation of the structure and the purposes of the United Nations Organization, showing the General Assembly, the Security Council, and the various commissions set up to further the cause of world peace and well-being. Commentary by Francis Williams.
